result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt J. Wylie

defendant.name: Wylie, Kurt J.
defendant.address: 1913 W Bone Lake Dr, Balsam Lake, WI 54810

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied to past due payment plan and fine in 13CF217.

CASES: 13CF217, 14CF124, 14CF362 Defendant Kurt J Wylie in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 8:42am Parties waive PSI. Def- pleas of G to Ct 1, 2 and 3 in 13CF217. CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC; DRI Cts 4, 5, 6, 7, & 8 and all of 14CF124 and 14CF362. 

SENTENCING on 13CF217: 

Ct 1- w/h sent, prob- 3 yrs, condition of probation: make existing Child Support pmts per month, $290.60 fine/cost, 75 hrs of CS: 25 hrs per year of probation.
Ct 2- w/h sent, prob- 1 yr- concurrent with Cts 1 & 3, bank 9 mos- to be used by agent if necessary, no fine/cost. 
Ct 3 w/h sent, prob 1year- concurrent to Cts 1 & 2, no fine/cost.   

cannot vote or hold public office, cannot possess firearms or body armor. DNA sample and surcharge. No contact w/ Jennifer Strenke. 9:05am adj.
DE pleads NG - Ct notes NG plea.  Ct - file to go to JA for scheduling.  Bond continues.

3:34 Defendant Kurt J. Wylie in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  ADA offers bond from 14CF124, recv'd.  MStoffel, S&T.  Cross by Atty Smested.  Atty Smested statement. ADA statement.  Ct finds probable cause.  Ct binds over.  ADA provides information to court.  20 days for any motions or substitutions.  Atty Smested wants to proceed w/arraingment.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.

14CF362, 14CF124 & 13CF217.  Defendant Kurt J. Wylie in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant Kurt J. Wylie in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:10 pm.  CT sets bond.  RSPH.  JA to set speedy PH w/ BSmestad w/ BPA.  Br 1 file.  Bonds cont.  1:15 pm adj.
